intro: Neorosea chevalieri, commonly known as the Chevalier's rose, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pink to reddish flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is native to specific regions in South America, particularly in the Andean foothills. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
